title: Romantic Valentine prompt page with evasive No button and celebratory meme

requirements.text: Create a single-page romantic Valentine prompt that asks: "Will you be my Valentine, Sunidhi?" and presents exactly two options: "Yes" and "No".

quotes: Create an interactive web page as a surprise for my girlfriend Sunidhi... to ask her to be my Valentine Sunidhi. There should be two options: Yes or No.

acceptanceCriteria: Page contains one primary prompt: "Will you be my Valentine, Sunidhi?" (English text).
Exactly two visible buttons are present: "Yes" and "No".
No additional app flows/pages/features beyond this interaction.

requirements.text: Implement evasive behavior for the "No" button so it cannot be clicked: when the user hovers over or otherwise points at "No", it moves to a new position within the visible viewport, staying fully on-screen and not overlapping the "Yes" button.

quotes: When she hovers her cursor over No, it should move away so she cannot click it, forcing her to click only on Yes.

acceptanceCriteria: On desktop: moving the cursor onto/over the "No" button causes it to reposition immediately.
On touch devices (iPad/Chrome): attempting to tap/press the "No" button triggers repositioning (e.g., on pointerdown/touchstart) before a click can register.
The "No" button never becomes unclickably off-screen; it remains fully visible after each move.
The "No" button does not cover or overlap the "Yes" button after repositioning.

requirements.text: When the user clicks/taps "Yes", replace the decision UI with a celebratory view that shows a meme image containing the text "Good choice❤❤❤".

quotes: When she clicks Yes, show her a meme image telling her "Good choice❤❤❤".

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking/tapping "Yes" shows a meme image with the exact text "Good choice❤❤❤" visible on the image.
After clicking "Yes", the user is no longer presented with both "Yes" and "No" choices (the UI transitions to the result state).

requirements.text: Apply a cohesive romantic visual theme using a pink and white color scheme, with simple, clean layout and responsive sizing optimized for iPad Chrome.

quotes: The page should be themed romantically with a pink and white color scheme... easily run it on my iPad using Chrome.

acceptanceCriteria: Overall styling is pink/white romantic-themed (background, buttons, typography) and visually consistent.
Layout is responsive and remains readable and usable on iPad-sized viewports in Chrome (no clipped prompt/buttons).
Animations/transitions (if any) remain smooth and do not block interaction.

requirements.text: Add the required generated meme image to the frontend as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and render it directly from the frontend (no backend serving or dynamic image generation at runtime).

quotes: show her a meme image telling her "Good choice❤❤❤".

acceptanceCriteria: A generated image file exists under frontend/public/assets/generated with the specified filename.
The "Yes" result view loads and displays the image via a static path from the frontend build (no backend calls required).

constraints: Use English for all user-facing text.

Do not edit files in frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or anything under frontend/src/components/ui (compose them instead).
Do not introduce any third-party authentication providers; Internet Identity only (even though it is not required for this page).
Keep the backend as a single Motoko actor; no additional backend services.
nonGoals: User accounts, authentication, or saving state on-chain.
Multiple pages, routing, or additional interactive mini-games.
Real-time features (websockets/chat), external APIs, or third-party integrations.

required: Meme-style image with bold readable caption text "Good choice❤❤❤", romantic pink/white aesthetic, simple comedic layout (valentine-good-choice-meme.dim_1200x800.png)
